title: Identify the Type of Conic
text: To determine which conic section is represented by the equation, examine the degrees and types of terms. Conic sections often have both $$x$$ and $$y$$ terms. Think about the presence of squared terms and their coefficients.

title: Consider the Form of the Equation
text: Check if the equation has the standard form of conic sections such as parabolas, ellipses, hyperbolas, or circles. Determine if there are any cross-product terms (xy terms) or if the coefficients of the square terms are balanced.

title: Understand the Terms
text: Identify the squared terms in the equation $$x^2$$, $$y^2$$, and other linear terms $$x$$, $$y$$. Consider how these relate to the conic’s shape. If there is one squared term of degree $$2$$, it typically represents a parabola.

title: Locate the Squared Term
text: Does the equation $$x^2-10x+4y-10=0$$ include terms with $$x$$ or $$y$$ squared? Focus on the term $$x^2$$.

title: Analyze the Structure
text: Identify other significant aspects, such as linear terms and constants, to understand whether the structure aligns with that of a parabola?
